channel.title: Minecraft Server <-> Forum Integration
channel.description:
I've been thinking of a good way to integrate forum accounts with minecraft accounts. We all have minecraft name fields on our profile, and I know I need to enforce that none of us have duplicates (so none of you can put 'moparisthebest' as your minecraft name, for example).
I'd like to make it so everyone who plays the server must have a forum account. The options I have here are to check for your minecraft name in the forum, and either make you use your forum password, or keep a separate password for your minecraft account. Since I run both of these, I'd like to make it so you use your forum password, but I'm afraid someone will miss a '/' and broadcast to the server their password with 'login thisismysecretpass8985', which makes me lean towards separate passwords.
Anyone have any good ideas regarding this? Or can you think of any potential issues I am forgetting?

item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“durial12, post:43, topic:390435”]Okay, first I will explain the whitelist:

A list of usernames. If a username is on the list then they can log onto the server. If the username is not on the list they will be unable to log onto the server.

Advantages
You can play with only selected people. This stops random players coming in and trashing/griefing other people’s work. Useful for small servers that don’t want “outsiders” joining their game.

Disadvantages
Whenever a new player wants to join, the host of the server must open and edit the file whitelist.txt and add the players name. This can be a pain if the host wishes the server to be open to other players. This is also a problem when removing players. We would have to wait for the host to remove the name from the whitelist or wait until they are banned.

Is sense made?[/quote]

yes you showed proof that whitelist is better
